title: How to Create a Forum Signature

steps.title: Find out the rules your forum may have about image signatures.
steps.content: Find out the rules your forum may have about image signatures. They may typically disallow images wider than 500 pixels, or ones with a file size of around 1 MB. For some other forums, they automatically adjust the size of your image to their specific file size.

steps.title: Choose the image that you want for your signature.
steps.content: Choose the image that you want for your signature. It may be a funny screenshot you found, an animation from a TV show, a humorous snippet from a web comic, or even gif format images are great. (be sure to follow attribution rules to avoid copyright infringement)

steps.title: Upload your image.
steps.content: Upload your image. You can Upload it on a photo-sharing site, such as Photobucket, Imgur, or Tinypic, etc. Forums only have limited Bandwidth so they don't allow direct uploading of images.

steps.title: Copy the appropriate URL to your image.
steps.content: Copy the appropriate URL to your image.

steps.title: Go to the 'Account settings' section of the forum and click "Edit signature" or something along that sort.
steps.content: Go to the 'Account settings' section of the forum and click "Edit signature" or something along that sort.

steps.title: Insert the link into the text box.
steps.content: Insert the link into the text box.
